duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee Financial Center Operations such as client service, cash flow, teller transaction processing, and POD scanning.
Maintain the Financial Center physical location and respond to facilities issues.
Manage Teller unit and other Financial Center staff, including hiring, terminations, performance reviews/management, time and attendance, scheduling, workflow management, and employee relations.
Review daily reports (new clients, overdrafts, general ledgers, etc.) and may proof teller, vault, and overall financial center on a daily basis.
Perform reviews and audits, prepare and submit monthly & quarterly reports in accordance with policy and procedure.
Assist PCGs/others with understanding bank policies and procedures, providing direction on transactions, etc.
Work with Group Directors to create/maintain an efficient business space and may assist with wires and other administrative tasks.
Provide training for new hires including on all product enhancements, and ensure proper procedures are adhered to in all areas of business in the Financial Center.
Maintain adequate supplies needed by tellers and bankers including cash, counter checks, official checks, money orders, cash, starter kits, stamps, etc.
Compile financial data by organization and government regulations; perform internal reviews of activity via reports and respond accordingly based on findings.
Complete ongoing training as required - Compliance, HR, etc.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
Minimum two years management experience in a financial center and compliance
Four years banking experience (commercial banking preferred)
Knowledge of financial service products and experience opening business accounts
